meanings.definition: A type of cell that engulfs and absorbs foreign particles, bacteria, and dead or dying cells.
meanings.sent1: The phagocytes in our body act like tiny vacuum cleaners, cleaning up any harmful invaders.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how phagocytes work to keep us healthy and fight off sickness.
meanings.sent3: The phagocytes in the immune system are like little Pac-Man characters gobbling up germs.
meanings.sent4: The phagocytes patrolled the body, devouring any unwanted guests like voracious beasts.
meanings.sent5: Imagine phagocytes as tiny superheroes, swooping in to save the day by defeating harmful intruders.

meanings.definition: Cells that are part of the body's immune system and help to protect against infections.
meanings.sent1: When the body is under attack, phagocytes rush to the rescue to fight off the invaders.
meanings.sent2: Phagocytes are like the body's own personal army, defending against harmful germs.
meanings.sent3: The phagocytes throw a party every time they successfully defeat an infection.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against sickness, phagocytes are the brave soldiers on the front lines.
meanings.sent5: The phagocytes work tirelessly to keep the body safe from harmful intruders, like vigilant guards.
